label.description: Add repositories from which extensions can be installed
label.disclaimer:
Suwayomi does not provide any support for 3rd party repositories or extensions!
Use with caution as there could be malicious actors making those repositories.
You as the user need to verify the security and that you trust any repository or extension.
label.title: Extension repositories

manga_thumbnail_backdrop.description: Sets the manga thumbnail as the background image on the manga page
manga_thumbnail_backdrop.title: Manga thumbnail as background

dialog.description:
See the official <0>MUI documentation</0> for how to customize the theme.
The palette API is not supported, you have to use the new <1>color schemes API</1>.

You can use theme creators like <2>MUI Theme Creator</2>, however, you have to adjust the created object according to the new color schemes API.

In case no background is defined, a background will be calculated based on the primary color

error.invalid_name: The theme name must be unique and has a limit of 16 characters

label.description: Back up library as a Tachiyomi backup
label.title: Create backup

label.description: You can also drag and drop the backup file here to restore it
label.title: Restore Backup

label.missing_sources: The following sources are not installed:
label.missing_trackers: The following trackers are not logged in:

label.title: Backup cleanup
label.value: Delete backups that are older than $t(global.date.value.label.day)

label.description: The path to the directory on the server where automated backups should get saved in
label.title: Backup location

label.description: The cache of the client (browser, electron) should get cleared alongside it, otherwise, the client cache will keep getting used
label.failure: Could not clear the server cache
label.title: Clear server cache

label.description: Select a device to use its server stored UI settings
label.title: Active device

label.description:
Manage your existing devices.
UI specific settings that are stored on the server are per device.
This makes it possible to have e.g. different settings on a desktop and a smartphone
label.title: Devices

label.language_description: Feel free to translate the project on

label.description: The address the client will use to connect to the server
Your browser will prompt you to enter credentials with a dialog.
label.title: Basic Authentication

label.description: Disable authentication
label.info: Your library will be accessible. Use this only on private networks or when otherwise securing access.
label.title: None

label.description: A simple login page will be presented to login.
label.info: When you enable this, you may need to refresh this tab for the login page to appear.
label.title: Simple Login

label.description: See <2>FlareSolverr</2> for information on how to set it up
label.title: FlareSolverr enabled

label.description: Use the FlareSolverr response in case the server runs into a Cloudflare challenge while FlareSolverr does not and is therefore unable to solve the challenge (does not work for images)
label.title: Response fallback

label.description: FlareSolverr will automatically rotate expired sessions based on the TTL provided in minutes
label.title: FlareSolverr session TTL

label.description: How much time FlareSolverr has to handle the request
label.title: FlareSolverr request timeout

label.description: The address of the FlareSolverr server
label.title: FlareSolverr server url

label.description: The path to the directory on the server where local source files are saved in
label.title: Local source location

file_cleanup.title: Log file cleanup
file_cleanup.value: Delete log files that are older than $t(global.date.value.label.day)

total_size.title: Maximum size of all log files

label.description: This includes logs with non privacy safe information
label.title: Enable graphql debug logs

label.description: This icon will be shown on the system that is running the server
label.title: Show icon in system tray

label.description: Display file sizes in binary (KiB, MiB, GiB) instead of decimal (KB, MB, GB)
label.title: Binary file size

label.description: Choose the order in which chapters are displayed.
label.title: Chapter sort order

label.description: Track and update your reading progress by page for each chapter during page streaming
label.title: Enable page read progress

label.description:
Number of items per page in OPDS feeds (e.g., Library History, Manga Chapters). 
Higher values may affect client performance.
label.title: Items per page

label.description: Automatically mark chapters as read when you download them.
label.title: Mark chapters as read on download

label.description: Filter manga feed to display only chapters you have downloaded.
label.title: Show only downloaded chapters

label.description: Filter manga feed to display only chapters you haven’t read yet.
label.title: Show only unread chapters

label.description: Use the version that was delivered with the server release
label.title: Bundled

label.description: Use the latest features and help us get them ready for a stable release.
label.disclaimer:
Features and changes in this version might not be completely ready yet and can cause bugs.
Make sure that you have automatic backups enabled to prevent loss of your library!

label.description: Use the latest released version.
label.title: Stable

label.info: After changing this setting go to the "About" page and check for a webUI update and install it
label.title: Flavor

label.description:
Use a custom $t(settings.webui.title.webui).
To use a custom $t(settings.webui.title.webui) replace the content of the "webUI" directory in the root directory on the server with the files of the custom $t(settings.webui.title.webui)
label.title: Custom

label.description: A preview focused web frontend built with svelte
label.title: VUI

label.description: Use the default $t(settings.webui.title.webui)

label.title: Interface
